etymologies: late 16th century: from obsolete Spanish, earlier form of zedilla, diminutive of zeda (the letter Z), from Greek zēta

definitions: a mark (¸) written under the letter c, especially in French, to show that it is pronounced like an s rather than a k (e.g. façade).
shortDefinitions: mark (¸) written under letter c to show that it is pronounced like s rather than k

definitions: a mark similar to a cedilla written under s in Turkish and other languages.
shortDefinitions: similar mark under s in Turkish and other oriental languages
